name: Yosemite National Park
description: Yosemite National Park is a national park of the United States in California. It is bordered on the southeast by the Sierra National Forest and on the northwest by Stanislaus National Forest. The park is managed by the National Park Service and covers 1,187 sq mi (3,070 km2) in four counties â€“ centered in Tuolumne and Mariposa, extending north and east to Mono and south to Madera. Designated a World Heritage Site in 1984, Yosemite is internationally recognized for its granite cliffs, waterfalls, clear streams, groves of giant sequoia, lakes, mountains, meadows, glaciers, and biological diversity. Almost 95 percent of the park is designated wilderness. Yosemite is one of the largest and least fragmented habitat blocks in the Sierra Nevada mountain range.

locations.name: El Capitan
locations.description: A vertical rock formation in Yosemite Valley, El Capitan is a favorite among rock climbers and offers stunning views of the surrounding area.

locations.name: Half Dome
locations.description: An iconic granite dome with a distinctive shape, Half Dome offers challenging hikes and panoramic views of Yosemite Valley.

locations.name: Bridalveil Fall
locations.description: A 620-foot waterfall located in the southern part of Yosemite Valley, known for its misty spray and picturesque setting.

locations.name: Mariposa Grove of Giant Sequoias
locations.description: Home to over 500 mature giant sequoias, this grove offers trails through ancient trees and a glimpse into the park's rich natural history.

locations.name: Tunnel View
locations.description: A famous viewpoint offering a panoramic view of Yosemite Valley, including El Capitan, Bridalveil Fall, and Half Dome.

routes.name: Mist Trail
routes.description: A popular trail leading to Vernal and Nevada Falls, offering misty views and a challenging hike.

routes.name: Half Dome Trail
routes.description: A strenuous trail leading to the summit of Half Dome, requiring a permit and offering breathtaking views.

routes.name: Glacier Point Trail
routes.description: A scenic trail leading to Glacier Point, offering panoramic views of Yosemite Valley and the High Sierra.

routes.name: Four Mile Trail
routes.description: A historic trail leading from Yosemite Valley to Glacier Point, offering stunning views along the way.

routes.name: Panorama Trail
routes.description: A trail offering panoramic views of Yosemite Valley, including views of Half Dome and the High Sierra.

tips: Secure permits in advance for popular hikes like Half Dome.
Start early to avoid crowds and enjoy cooler temperatures.
Carry plenty of water and snacks, especially on longer hikes.
Be aware of seasonal conditions and trail closures.
Practice Leave No Trace principles to preserve the park's beauty.
